occupation: Medical Assistant at Orthopaedic Rehabilitation Institution
headline: Medical Assistant at Orthopedic Rehabilitation Institution

experiences.title: Medical Assistant
experiences.description: - Worked with 3000+ new chronic pain patients directly to populate an accurate medical history and performed over 3000 physical medical assessments to determine musculoskeletal structural issues - Created and compiled the necessary documentation for the Out of Hospital Inspection Program (OHPIP) for the clinic, successfully passing without conditions- Update and implement new clinic policies to match current CPSO guidelines bi-annually. - Main point of contact with numerous vendors for the acquisition of medication and medical equipment. - Manage clinic inventory by performing weekly counts, ordering supplies, and confirming receipt- Collaborate with physiotherapists and orthopaedic surgeons to create and update protocols for musculoskeletal rehabilitation

experiences.title: Volunteer - OTA/PTA Support
experiences.description: - Assigned activities to stroke survivors to maximize their upper extremity strength & dexterity.- Assisted OTA/PTA with modified exercise class by monitoring patients for proper exercise form. - Explained and demonstrated how to perform modified exercises for patients with weakness and/or paralysis in affected extremities.- Unfortunately I had to cease volunteering due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, but I hope to resume as soon as possible.

experiences.title: Server
experiences.description: - Curated a welcoming atmosphere for each individual guest to enjoy their dining experience.- Communicated with management and customers to solve customer disputes quickly and efficiently.- Worked with my team to support them whenever it was needed.

experiences.title: Student Therapist
experiences.description: - First responder for the University of Toronto Men's Varsity Blues Soccer Team- Treated athlete injuries independently during practices - Assessed athletes and made the initial determination of injury at practice - Provided instruction on steps to take post-injury depending on the severity level- Assisted registered physiotherapist Carlo Andreatta with injury diagnosis and treatment during games

experiences.title: Lead Server
experiences.description: - Monitored and assisted other servers with any complications when supervisors and managers were not present- Responsible for overseeing opening / closing and coaching and mentoring new servers regarding menu items, company policies and procedures. - Catered to private members individually, remembering specific orders to create a welcoming experience.

experiences.title: Hostess
experiences.description: - I handled in-person and over-the-phone guest inquiries, questions, and reservations.- I taught myself beginner organizational skills through seating charts and pacing seating as to not overwhelm servers and kitchen staff. - I monitored guests for intoxication and reported any concerns to management.

experiences.title: Volunteer
experiences.description: - I provided activities for children to ensure they had an optimal experience while at summer camp - I independently supervised children during lunch hours and de-escalated any issues that arose between campers- I collaborated with camp counsellors to resolve any matters that were not within the scope of my job duties

experiences.title: Volunteer Co-op Student
experiences.description: - Assisted physiotherapist with treatment- Performed clerical duties

education.description: Completed final year with a 3.65 GPA
